nachos.machine

Class Machine

  • java.lang.Object
    • nachos.machine.Machine

  • public class Machine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the simulated host workstation hardware, as seen by user programs -- the CPU registers, main memory, etc. User programs shouldn't be able to tell that they are running on our simulator or on the real hardware, except we don't support floating point instructions the system call interface to Nachos is not the same as UNIX (10 system calls in Nachos vs. 200 in UNIX!) If we were to implement more of the UNIX system calls, we ought to be able to run Nachos on top of Nachos!

    • Field Detail

      • NUM_CPUS

        public static final int NUM_CPUS
        The number of CPUs on the system -- must be at least 1. If there is just one CPU, then there is no real concurrent execution of threads and the spin lock synchronization facility is bypassed. If there is more than one CPU, then threads running on different CPUs will run concurrently as Java threads, and will run truly concurrently if the host system is a multi-CPU system and the JVM supports it.

      • CPUTimerInt

        public static final int CPUTimerInt
        IntType records which type of hardware device generated an interrupt. In Nachos, we support a per-cpu scheduling timer, a general-purpose timer device, a disk, a console display and keyboard, a network, and a serial port.
        See Also:

      • setInterruptMask

        public static boolean setInterruptMask(int type)
        Selectively mask a particular type of interrupt. If a type of interrupt is masked, then interrupts of that type will not be handled on any CPU as long as the mask is set. This is used to protect critical sections in device drivers. Interrupts should not be left masked for any longer than necessary. NOTE: CPU scheduling timer interrupts are not maskable by this method. They only affect one CPU and should be masked by disabling interrupts on that CPU.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of interrupt to be masked.
        Returns:
        false if the mask was previously clear and is now successfully set, true if the mask was already set.

      • clearInterruptMask

        public static void clearInterruptMask(int type)
        Remove a mask on a particular type of interrupt.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of interrupt to be unmasked.

      • showInterruptMask

        public static void showInterruptMask()
        Show the current interrupt mask, for debugging purposes.
